projects.description: The official JEC wiki repository.

projects.description: The official JEC Website repository.

projects.description: A collection of sample Enterprise JavaScript Projects (EJPs) that can be deployed in GlassCat application servers.

projects.description: Mocking library for testing objects built over the JavaScript Dependency Injection API (JDI).

projects.label: jec-sokoke
projects.description: The Sokoke framework is the default implementation of the JavaScript Dependency Injection (JDI) specification.

projects.label: jec-glasscat-core
projects.description: The core components of the Glasscat Aplication Server.

projects.label: jec-sandcat
projects.description: The GlassCat implementation for building RESTful web services in TypeScript, based upon the JARS specification.

projects.label: jec-tiger
projects.description: Tiger is a unit testing framework for the TypeScript programming language based upon the JEC JUTA specification.

projects.label: jec-jdi
projects.description: The JavaScript Dependency Injection (JDI) framework provides the ability to inject components into a JEC application in a typesafe way.

projects.label: jec-glasscat-install
projects.description: Contains install utilities for the GlassCat application server.

projects.label: jec-glasscat
projects.description: GlassCat Application Server is the default JEC implementation.

projects.label: jec-exchange-mock
projects.description: Mocking library for testing objects built over the JEC Exchange API, including @WebJslets and @Bootstrap decorators.

projects.label: jec-exchange
projects.description: A standardized and portable way to provide JavaScript dynamic applications.

projects.label: jec-commons-node
projects.description: Node.js reusable components related to the JavaScript Enterprise Container (JEC) specification.

projects.label: jec-commons
projects.description: Reusable components related to the JavaScript Enterprise Container (JEC) specification.

projects.label: jec-cli
projects.description: CLI tool for managing JEC projects. You typically use JEC CLI to install and start a GlassCat application server.

projects.label: jec-cli-template
projects.description: Provides functionalities for creating JEC components from a Command Line Interface.

projects.label: jec-gpm-microservice
projects.description: A GlassCat Project Model (GPM) that deploys microservices based on the JavaScript API for REST Services (JARS).

projects.label: jec-gpm-angular
projects.description: A GlassCat Project Model (GPM) that deploys Angular applications with Material dependencies.

projects.label: jec-gpm-basic
projects.description: A GlassCat Project Model (GPM) that deploys standard Enterprise JavaScript Projects (EJPs).

projects.label: jec-jars-mock
projects.description: Mocking library for testing services built over the JavaScript API for Restful Services (JARS).

projects.label: jec-glasscat-metadata
projects.description: Contains utility tools for working with GlassCat server metadata.

projects.label: jec-wildcat
projects.description: The archetype manager for the GlassCat Application Server.

projects.label: jec-juta
projects.description: A simple API to write repeatable tests over common JavaScript unit testing frameworks.

projects.label: jec-jars
projects.description: Provides support for annotations that make it easy for developers to build RESTful web services.

projects.label: jec-glasscat-commands
projects.description: Contains default commands used by GlassCat CLI to manage utilities.

projects.label: jec-cheetoh
projects.description: The GlassCat Project Model (GPM) manager.

projects.description: The Manx framework is the default implementation of the JavaScript WebSocket (JWS) specification.

projects.description: The JavaScript WebSocket (JWS) framework enables full-duplex communication in JEC applications.

projects.description: A sample project to show the JUTA default implementation: Tiger.

projects.description: Contains default commands used by GlassCat CLI to manage utilities.
